## Opgave 1
Read the data into R and plot the data. Argue that it is not a good idea to use a general linear model

```{r, include = FALSE}
library("readxl")
DATA_HANDIN <- read_excel("Downloads/DATA_HANDIN.xlsx")
data <- DATA_HANDIN

```

```{r}
plot(data)
```

## Opgave 2
Use the glm function to fit a simple inverse Gaussian regression model to the data with the link function used by R. (Hint: In glm, use family=inverse.gaussian(link="1/mu^2")). Extract the estimated Î² parameters

```{r}
x <- data$x
y <- as.numeric(data$y)
mu <- mean(y)

mod = glm(formula=y~x,family=inverse.gaussian(link = "1/mu^2"))
coef = coefficients(mod); coef
```


## Opgave 3

```{r}
confbeta = confint.default(mod); confbeta
```


## Opgave 4

```{r}
curve((coef[1] + coef[2]*x)^(1/(-2)),add=TRUE,col="red") 
```


## Opgave 5

```{r}
D = deviance(mod); D
1-pchisq(D,length(x)-length(coef))
```
